zone.line: An old, mad, blind, despised & dying King;
Princes, the dregs of thier dull race, who flow
Through public scorn,— mud from a muddy
Rulers who neither see nor feel nor know
But leechlike to their fainting country cling
Till they drop, blind in blood, without a blow.
A people starved & stabbed on th'untilled field,
An army which whom liberticide & prey
Makes as a two-edged sword to all who
Religion Christless, Godless, a book seald,

line.del: A cloak of lies worn on Powe'rs holiday,

zone.line: Are graves from which a glorious Phantom
Burst, to illumine our tempestuous day
A senate, Tim Times worst statute, unrepealed
